Introduction to Confee - Type-Safe Configuration Management Hello! Today, I’d like to introduce Confee, a configuration management library I developed.
ğŸ¤” Why I Created Confee When developing Python applications, configuration management has always been challenging:
ğŸ˜• Reading YAML/JSON files as dictionaries loses type information ğŸ˜¤ Managing priorities of environment variables, CLI arguments, and configuration files is complex ğŸ˜© High risk of runtime errors when configuration changes Existing solutions like Hydra and OmegaConf are powerful, but require significant boilerplate code.
âœ¨ Key Features of Confee 1. Type Safety (with Pydantic V2) from confee import ConfigBase class AppConfig(ConfigBase): name: str debug: bool = False workers: int = 4 config = AppConfig.load(config_file="config.yaml") # IDE autocomplete support! print(config.name) # str print(config.debug) # bool print(config.workers) # int 2. Multi-Source Support Manage all configurations from one place:
# config.yaml name: my-app debug: false workers: 8 # Override with environment variables export CONFEE_DEBUG=true export CONFEE_WORKERS=16 # Override with CLI arguments python app.py debug=true workers=32 3. Nested Configuration Structure class DatabaseConfig(ConfigBase): host: str = "localhost" port: int = 5432 class AppConfig(ConfigBase): name: str database: DatabaseConfig # Access with dot notation # python app.py database.host=prod.db database.port=3306 4. File Reference Support # config.yaml name: my-app api_key: "@file:secrets/api_key.txt" database_config: "@config:configs/database.yaml" 5. Auto Help Generation python app.py --help # Automatically displays all configuration options and defaults! ğŸš€ Getting Started Installation pip install confee # or uv pip install confee Basic Usage from confee import ConfigBase class AppConfig(ConfigBase): app_name: str debug: bool = False port: int = 8000 # Load configuration config = AppConfig.load(config_file="config.yaml") # Access type-safely if config.debug: print(f"Debug mode enabled on {config.app_name}") ğŸ“Š Feature Comparison Feature Confee Hydra OmegaConf Pydantic Integration âœ… âš ï¸ âŒ Type Safety âœ… âŒ âŒ Auto Help âœ… âš ï¸ âŒ Simple API âœ… âŒ âš ï¸ Nested Field Access âœ… âœ… âœ… ğŸ¯ Use Cases Using with FastAPI from fastapi import FastAPI from confee import ConfigBase class AppConfig(ConfigBase): title: str = "My API" debug: bool = False config = AppConfig.load( config_file="config.yaml", source_order=["env", "file"] # Exclude CLI ) app = FastAPI(title=config.title, debug=config.debug) Environment-Specific Configuration import os from confee import ConfigBase env = os.getenv("APP_ENV", "dev") config = AppConfig.load(config_file=f"{env}.yaml") Configuration Validation from pydantic import Field class AppConfig(ConfigBase): workers: int = Field(ge=1, le=128) # 1~128 range timeout: float = Field(gt=0) # Positive only ğŸ“ˆ Release Information Current Version: 0.1.2 (2025-12-21)
Latest Features (0.1.2) âœ… Initial stable release âœ… Full Pydantic V2 support âœ… Multi-source configuration (file/environment/CLI) âœ… Dot notation nested field access âœ… File reference support (@file:, @config:) âœ… Configuration inheritance (override_with()) âœ… Strict/non-strict validation modes âœ… Auto help generation âœ… 91% code coverage (116 tests) ğŸ”— Learn More ğŸ“– GitHub Repository ğŸ“¦ PyPI Package ğŸ“š Comparison Document ğŸ—ï¸ Development Guide In the next post, I’ll explore Confee’s advanced features in detail!
